title: Prosciutto-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with Crispy Sage Recipe
description: Prosciutto-wrapped pork tenderloin with crispy sage is a quick and easy meal made with only 5 ingredients for a fancy dinner any night of the week.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Meat and Poultry Pork Pork Tenderloin Recipes Prosciutto-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with Crispy Sage 4.7 (17) 12 Reviews 5 Photos Turn your weeknight dinner into a fancy affair with this easy pork tenderloin recipe. Submitted by hello angie Updated on December 2, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 1 pound pork tenderloin Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 pound pork tenderloin salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 bunch fresh sage, leaves removed and stems discarded, divided 6 ounces prosciutto 1 tablespoon olive oil, or more as needed Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly season pork with salt and black pepper. Arrange about 6 sage leaves over tenderloin. Wrap prosciutto around tenderloin and sage, overlapping prosciutto slightly; wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate to allow prosciutto to set on pork tenderloin, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove plastic wrap. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry wrapped tenderloin in the hot oil until prosciutto is crispy and lightly browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer wrapped tenderloin to a baking dish, reserving oil in the skillet. Bake tenderloin in the preheated oven until pork is cooked through, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Heat reserved oil in the skillet over medium heat; fry remaining sage leaves until crispy, adding more oil as needed, about 5 minutes. Slice tenderloin and serve with crispy sage leaves. Add Your Photo Photos of Prosciutto-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with Crispy Sage 01 of 05 Photo by  hello angie 02 of 05 Photo by  JovialMixer3140 09/29/2024 Family favorite 03 of 05 Photo by  Todd Ortscheid 08/11/2023 The time was WAY off, but the meal was great. I had to cook more than double this time in the oven. The quoted time would only work for a very thin pork loin. Overall, great flavor. The sage works well with this. 04 of 05 Photo by  Red Corvett 04/21/2021 This is a great quick recipe, delicious and moist. I just added a drizzle of balsamic reduction. Delish! 05 of 05 Photo by  hello angie 10/29/2015 1 You’ll Also Love Stuffed Pork Tenderloin 99 Ratings Chef John's Yucatan-Style Grilled Pork 58 Ratings Rosemary Pork Roast 212 Ratings Portuguese Pork with Red Peppers 124 Ratings Parsley and Parmesan Crusted Pork Tenderloin 94 Ratings Grilled Pork Tenderloin with Balsamic Honey Glaze 34 Ratings Lavender Pork Steaks 12 Ratings Best Balsamic Marinated Pork Tenderloin 20 Ratings Garlic Herb Grilled Pork Tenderloin 173 Ratings Pork Roast with Thyme 350 Ratings Coffee-Rubbed Pork Tenderloin with Espresso-Honey Glace 2 Ratings Pork in Olive Oil Marinade 36 Ratings Easy One-Pan Pork and Squash Dinner 9 Ratings Air Fryer Mustard-Crusted Pork Tenderloin with Potatoes and Green Beans 18 Ratings Pork Tenderloin with Creamy Herb Sauce 328 Ratings Citrus Pork Tenderloin 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: hello angie

Wrap prosciutto around tenderloin and sage, overlapping prosciutto slightly; wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate to allow prosciutto to set on pork tenderloin, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove plastic wrap.;Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry wrapped tenderloin in the hot oil until prosciutto is crispy and lightly browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer wrapped tenderloin to a baking dish, reserving oil in the skillet.;Bake tenderloin in the preheated oven until pork is cooked through, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).;Heat reserved oil in the skillet over medium heat; fry remaining sage leaves until crispy, adding more oil as needed, about 5 minutes.;Slice tenderloin and serve with crispy sage leaves.
